Articles.Content:
Hello everyone,

Well, I've never really been into forums, but hey, it's Kerbal Space Program so I really have to try this. :)
I've been playing Kerbal Space Program on and off since around version 0.19 . I only play the game vanilla, no mods for me. Although I consider myself a somewhat experienced player, my habit of starting a new game every major update has prevented me from ever really getting past Duna.

Lately I've had more time on my hands so I'm currently playing a Science Game with my intention to colonise space!!!!:D

Greetings,

Puddle Jumper.

Hello Puddle Jumper, and welcome to the forum!

I had always tended to avoid internet forums until KSP. My last one was an Amiga Users Group BBS.

Happy landings!

Yeah, IMO most forums tend to be worse than this one. A better group of online people I've never found.

Welcome aboard!
These forums definitely are the internet's best.

Welcome to the forums Puddle Jumper! I have to admit that I am in the exact same position as you. Purchased KSP in July 2013, logged just over 850 hours, and have only been to Kerbin's system, Duna, and Eve. Restarting with every update (and postponing play until the update is out) doesn't help at all.

Have fun on the forums!

Welkom op het forum!

[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[quote name='Starhawk']Hello Puddle Jumper, and welcome to the forum!

I had always tended to avoid internet forums until KSP. My last one was an Amiga Users Group BBS.

Happy landings![/QUOTE]

Funny ... I've been there too. But you really mean BBS, like in dial-up? That must be 20 years ago!

[quote name='Azimech']Funny ... I've been there too. But you really mean BBS, like in dial-up? That must be 20 years ago![/QUOTE]

More like 25 years or so. And yes, dial-up was all there was back then. I went through a few modems in my day, especially as the tech changed and they got faster and faster.

Happy landings!

Greetings from a Kiwi living in New Zealand but born in the Netherland.

To be precise: Asten, Noord Brabant way back in 1960.

Welcome to the forum, pull up a char, and lets talk. :)
